title: I spent years tracking down my birth father... but meeting him was the biggest disappointment of my life
text:
I met my birth father, Frank*, for the first time under a fig tree in Mallorca. I was 50 years old. I chose the location carefully: the tree, strewn with fairy lights, had been growing in my Uncle Gabriel’s* garden for decades and had assumed almost mythical status in the family.

But as Frank walked towards me, white-bearded and dapper in a blazer and trilby, the hairs on my neck rose. Suddenly I felt an instant, visceral dislike. We’d been emailing for months and, though apprehensive, I’d imagined we would form an instant connection, so my reaction was a shock.
